website_summaries.verdict: The shoe sports impressive durability and superb traction. The precise fit makes users think that it was custom made for them. It also boasts with its flexible design. It does not compromise the support it rendered to consumers despite being lightweight. The widest point of the forefoot area served as a stable base, allowing wearers to perform powerful push-offs.However, the shoe’s extended break-in period, poor waterproofing, and insufficient ventilation let consumers down. Overall, the reasonably priced pair of hikers from Merrell may deliver adequate performance on demanding trails, as long as wearers break it in first.
pros: The great fit of the Merrell Moab 2 Waterproof makes a high percentage of users feel that the shoes are custom made for them
A majority of wearers observe that the traction of the sole is remarkable especially on wet, uneven grounds
Its versatility is phenomenal, according to some hikers
They note that they can wear it while working, hiking, or just walking around town
Many appreciate the affordable price of the Moab 2 Waterproof given the outstanding quality it has
The shoe is amazingly lightweight, a few users claim
Several consumers commend this Merrell hiker for its super-reliable arch support
A good number of testers who have worn it for miles laud the durability of the pair
cons: The Moab 2 Waterproof is too warm on hot days, some buyers testify
This issue makes them question its breathability
A considerable number of wearers dislike the extended break-in period it needs
One even suffers from severe blistering, mentioning that pain is felt every time he walks
A handful of users detest the waterproofing ability of the pair
They say that it wasn’t able to keep their feet dry after simply walking on damp grass

customer_reviews.title: I AM A PRIME MEMBER Merrell Men's Moab 2 Waterproof ...
customer_reviews.text: I AM A PRIME MEMBER Merrell Men's Moab 2 Waterproof Hiking Shoe, Bark Brown, right shoe started leaking at pinky toe,(NOTE: AMAZON WILL NOT COVER WARRANTY, ITS BEEN 3 MONTHS AND 6 DAYS FROM PURCHASE). Wet spot after walking in morning dew. I am retired 70 yrs. young with daily walks with my 2.5 yr. old German Shepard. Going to try Merrell directly now. Show much for that SUB PRIME SERVICE.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE - FALLING APART AFTER 2 MONTHS - Not as Wide as the "Old" Moab - same size may be too tight
customer_reviews.text: The old Moab (not the Moab 2) was considerably wider. If you have a wide foot and you like the "old" Moab you may not like the Moab 2. With the exact same sizes of Moab vs. Moab 2, the Moab is wider and more comfortable. My Moab 2s aren't nearly as comfortable as my Moabs due to the 2 being narrower. YMMV UPDATE, The shoes are falling apart after only two months. They look new but the soles are coming off. These are junk compared to my old Moabs (NOT the 2). Stay away from Merrell. They went down the tubes IMO. VERY DISAPPOINTED. :(
customer_reviews.author: sampleaccurate

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes in mid-January and within one month the uppers have started to split from the souls.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Berthelsen

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are like walking with bricks on your feet
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are like walking with bricks on your feet. I would be returning them, but missed the deadline. Very stiff shoe, not much padding. The left toe box doesn't fit well at all. They feel smaller than the Merrell 13 W pair I have. They are water proof. Not easy on your feet at all. 13000 steps in these shoes is all my feet could take. Very stiff, clunky is the best word I have for them.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof shoe, sized a little small.
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend is typically in between a size 13 and 14 and we first ordered a 13, but had to get the bigger size. It's been about 2 weeks now and he loves these shoes. He does a lot of crouching down low and jumping up and down off trailers so he didn't want something super stiff, but he needed water proof. After standing in 2"s of water all day and moving around working he came home with dry feet and very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Worst Merralls I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Worst Merralls I have ever purchased. They leaked right of the box with just a small splash of water. You could tell the glued seams were going to separate in no time. I have been a long time Merrell buyer but will now look to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not the same Merrell
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these that lasted 3 years. I walked all over Europe in them, so when I finally wore them out I ordered another pair of the same size. They were too small, so I exchanged them. They are so uncomfortable I donated them after giving them three weeks of use. I went to another brand. Sad- Merrell used to be good.
customer_reviews.author: Dave5150

customer_reviews.title: Beware - New Mfg. (Different Fit than Moab Ventilator Original)
customer_reviews.text: These do not fit at all like the old (original) Moab Ventilators. It seems like Merrell switched manufacturers. The new fit is awful; the shoes now run very long (for their size), and if you go down a size they are too narrow. Switch to the wide option? Nope--rather than just being wider, the shoe is longer as well (not a true wide fit). Where the hell is Merrell having these made now? Great shoe quality doesn't matter if the fit is awful. Sad to have to switch brands/styles after buying these for nearly a decade.
customer_reviews.author: Nostradamus

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered twice and both pairs were too small even though the 2nd pair was a size larger than what is normally worn. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as the last pair.
customer_reviews.text: I had another pair of these shoes and liked them so I bought this set in the same size and color. These were obviously made on a different last. They are smaller in length and not as deep. The tongue is wider and the parts that join the uppers tends to fold down into the top of my foot. I normally wear a 10 1/2 wide. These don't come in wide, so I bought an 11. My toes impact the end of the toes when I walk down a slight incline.
customer_reviews.author: WGE G'Dad

customer_reviews.title: These Merrell hiking shoes Men's Moab 2 looked great but did not fit as Merrell Men's Moab in ...
customer_reviews.text: These Merrell hiking shoes Men's Moab 2 looked great but did not fit as Merrell Men's Moab in the past. They were too narrow even though tagged on the shoe as 9.5 EE. I ordered 2 times to find ones that fit. I had the same problem recently with Columbia shoes in trying to find a wide that was you guessed it, wide enough. I had to send back both the Merrell Moab 2 and the Columbia shoes with the same problem, too small of length and width. I will have to check out hiking shoes at the mall stores now. thanks for reading
customer_reviews.author: D. E.

customer_reviews.title: Rubs socks/creates holes, plus odor issues
customer_reviews.text: Like many people I have one foot slightly larger (millimeters) than the other. Mine is the left foot, so I always order a size that works for the largest foot, which for me is 11.5M. This shoe has an issue with being inconsistent; the right side is fine, and fits snug but the right side is loose and the hiking socks rub when hiking and wear holes in a day. In addition, my feet barely sweat and I very rarely have any odor but with these shoes the materials cause excessive sweating, even without socks and there is an immediate issue of sweat accumulation leading to odor. Bottom line, not my favorite shoe and will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Toe design has changed
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this shoe for many years, because I like the way it fits & looks. But in this latest order, the design of the toe has changed - there's now a lot more of the 'vented' cloth above the toe. I'm not sure if the new design is better or worse from a technical & fit standpoint, but I think it looks worse. I think the new design makes the shoe look "too wide" (I do wear a 13 wide ... but I don't want it to 'look' wider than necessary due to the design). In the picture, the new shoe is on the left, and my old one is on the right.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not the color advertised
customer_reviews.text: The item received appeared to be their Beluga color shoe. Not the Bark Brown color ordered. Although the box was marked indicating Bark Brown, the shoes I received were not the same color as the photo. I then also ordered them directly from Merrill and received the same Beluga color even though the box is marked Bark Brown. I think Merrell supplier has an issue telling color. Or is putting the incorrect shoe in the box.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great for gripping rock surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several pairs of Merrell hiking shoes before, including earlier versions of the Moab. This is the first time with the Moab 2 shoe. The gripping surface on the bottom is the best of anything out there right now. Very sure grip, even coming downhill on loose gravel or solid rock. You'll feel confident wearing these on any hiking trail, even those that have sharp slopes. The shoe is comfy overall. I have a slightly narrower foot but had no problem tightening the laces a bit to give me a great fit. Won't know how long these will last until I get there, but other Merrell's of similar design lasted very long.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. D123

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Durability-TBD
customer_reviews.text: So the fit was great. The support that I was looking for in a daily shoe is excellent. I've had Merrells in the past and I used them for work shoes. The comfort and durability were outstanding. I'm hoping that these Moab 2's can repeat that kind of performance. I like that they're waterproof and so far, they seem very well built and comfortable. I will edit as time passes to update on durability. Later edit: A difficult rock climb up Blue Mountain, and these shoes passed with flying colors. Still waterproof, very steady on uneven surfaces, rocks, roots and extreme ascent and descent. No hotspots, no blisters, very comfortable. I'm liking them a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Pocock

customer_reviews.title: Merrills Are Too Notch Footware.
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoe. Superior in every way -- fit, quality of construction, appearance, and, most of all, support for one's entire foot. Extraordinary comfort for all day use. Would give them a ten star rating of I could. One thing to note, however, the price on these shoes varies tremendously and seemingly for no reason. Would advise watching prices for a couple of days (or even weeks) to try to get the best bargain. I purchased mine for less than sixty dollars and within a week or two they were selling for over a hundred dollars. Also, check different colors; some colors can be as much as 50% less than other colors. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Bill R

customer_reviews.title: Shoe is nice but tight in the toe
customer_reviews.text: Having feet with a longest middle toe, shoe fit is hit and miss. In this case the toe box is a bit cramped. After wearing the shoes all day, I wind up with painful toes. Yuck. This is particularly troublesome when hiking sloped terrain. Uphill walks are fine. But what goes up must come down. My toes jam with each step. There is no issue with the quality of the shoe. I simply have hard to fit feet.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: these take the punishment you would expect
customer_reviews.text: I am hard on shoes and abuse them more than most people would. So far they have held up and have been comfortable in all of my outdoor activities which are hiking, fishing, hunting. Feet stay reasonably dry and supported in all the types of terrain i have been in including mountain trails, farm fields and forests. I have had Plantar issues in the past and these shoes have helped support my arch.
customer_reviews.author: robert grudberg

customer_reviews.title: Happy Return buyer
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable hiking shoes and that's why its the third pair I've purchased. I have a foot condition call Neuroma's (both feet) that are inflamed nerves that make walking very painful. I found that these shoes are the only ones that actually stop the pain as if it didn't exist. This pair is for work, my last pair is for hiking and the oldest pair is for yard work. Love these things. BTW Be aware that the older pairs I bought fit about 1/2 size larger than the stated shoe size but these newer modals fit true to stated size. Other people have found this also.
customer_reviews.author: DB Cooper

customer_reviews.title: A little short in the 9, would have to wear a lighter sock
customer_reviews.text: The toe box is just barely big enough and I am female and usually wear a woman's 10 B but resort to men's shoes to get more wiggle room up front. Not sure if the 9.5 in men's would be better. There is also a pretty weird sensation in the heel where it's built up on the inside and shifts your weight inward, like it's designed to keep your foot from rolling outward, a problem I don't have. I took out their insole and put a plain one of my own in and that felt much better.
customer_reviews.author: P. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great choice!
customer_reviews.text: This low hiker is the most comfortable and durable I have ever had. This is my third pair. I wore out my first pair and still have the second two which are different color choices. The size fits me perfectly. I have big and wide feet and am fortunate that my size (13E) is usually available on Amazon (can never find in a retail store!). They are very well constructed and have the best tread/sole available which is yellow label Vibram. In my opinion, they live up to their Moab acronym (Mother Of All Boots).
customer_reviews.author: Juno Fairbanks

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe, but a bit heavy and snug fitting
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Merrell MOAB shoes for the past 8 years, and they hold up excellently and normally fit me very well. However, I found these waterproof model to be a bit heavier in weight than I would like, and they also fit a bit too snug for me in my standard size. I also ordered and tried a pair of the GPX (Gortex version) which were lighter weight and fit me much better, so I kept them, and returned this waterproof model. In general, I love the Merrell MOAB shoes, and will continue to wear them as my everyday shoe (I am retired) as they are comfortable, wear like iron and provide excellent support.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry R

customer_reviews.title: The real deal at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great value! Why pay retail $125 for waterproof version when you can pay $69? Genuine Merrell, true Vibram, nice and stiff and flexible after a nice 2 mile break-in. Don’t fall for the knockoffs on other websites like graceve.com these scammers show Merrell but deliver junk instead and you’ll never get your money back. (not slander, I have proof, photos, and 14 pages of emails...) Stick with Amazon and their trusted vendors, who never let you down. These are great, bought 2 pairs, saved a bunch and extremely happy.
customer_reviews.author: XQZMOISVP

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Moabs for years with never a size issue. I ordered the same size as the last 5 pairs and these are just plain uncomfortable. I ordered a 9.5 wide and this feels like a plain 9 regular. Sent them back. Very disappointed. Now I have to go through the hassle of trying on different shoes, different styles. Merrill, If you are listening - your quality control people are in serious need of retraining.
customer_reviews.author: Secret Weapon

customer_reviews.title: Runs half a size small
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my husband but he ended up exchanging them for half a size larger than his usual size. We bought these for a trip to Italy where we would be walking around outdoors, including some hiking in wet weather. My husband said they were very comfortable, more so than a pair of trail running shoes he owns. Since they are waterproof, they don't breathe all that well and so foot odor is a problem if worn all day. Luckily the soles are washable and dry quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs W

customer_reviews.title: Well named mother of all
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I buy them and put them on and they fit! The end. I hate shoe shopping. As a woman with a man's size foot its a nightmare to find a shoe that doesn't hurt my feet. I've worn many pairs in the last 10 years. I curently work full time as a maintenance tech outside and walk all day long in dirt, mud, sand, water, crap of several orgins... I use clorine, acid, and many other harsh chemicals and the shoes still look pretty good! Bought my last pair a year ago, back for a new pair to use as 'nice shoes' before my old pair get worse.
customer_reviews.author: Gemma

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoe but water resistant not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable shoe for hiking or everyday walking. This is a good casual travel shoe. HOWEVER, this shoe is not waterproof....perhaps it is water resistant. I will definitively purchase another pair for their comfort and durability. But I will buy another shoe if I require it to be waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Initial impressions, it fits true to size, and it is true what they say, it is comfortable from the get go and does not require any break in period. It is not insulated, but it is water proof. With some good socks, I was able to use this during some minor snow falls and slightly below freezing temps. Also good for milder temperatures. These are not however, winter shoes, but will hold their own with some minor winters conditions for a bit. Thick soles that protect you well from rocks etc. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Erock

customer_reviews.title: Slightly under sized toe box
customer_reviews.text: I do like the shoe overall but it does have a slightly smaller toe box. I have been working to break the shoes in and it is loosening up some however. I also tried on the non waterproof version and the toebox was not nearly as tight. Not sure if that has something to do with the different versions or if it's just the specific shoe I had. Do keep in mind when buying a waterproof shoe that your feet won't breathe nearly as well and you will tend to get sweating more often.
customer_reviews.author: Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are as comfortable as my sneakers. I did go 1/2 size up after reading reviews and I think that's a major reason why they fit so well. They do get a little hot but that's supposed to happen with waterproofing. Think about it... No comment on longevity as they are new. I'll update after the New York winter when they get tested for sure!!! I have high hopes for these since they are Merrells. I have a pair of Merrell waterproof hiking boots that are rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: lambflirta

customer_reviews.title: Moab 2's are much narrower than originals
customer_reviews.text: My old pair were very tired, maybe six years or more of frequent use. They were 9.5 US, regular width, so I ordered a same sized pair. Significantly narrower and un-wearable so I took pictures and sent them back. I'm now wearing a pair of 9.5W, and they fit pretty close to the same as my old ones, though those were stretched out and a lot more flexible. Haven't tested the waterproofing, but anything will be an improvement. I'll post pics if I can find a link to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Mister T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Wore these to both walk and hike around Ireland and Scotland. Being that I’m a woman and having to wear a men’s size because this company doesn’t carry them large enough for me, they fit surprisingly well. I think I would prefer it to have a little better arch support but other than that they worked exactly as described. I sprayed with extra waterproofing after reading other reviews. This resulted in excellent waterproofing - through puddles of water and mud. Great traction on Giants Causeway (saw others slipping while I hopped around the stones without any misstep) and in slippery castle ruins and on cobble stones. Perfect footwear
customer_reviews.author: Susan E.

customer_reviews.title: Good waterproofing for mildly messy trail
customer_reviews.text: 9.5 fits wide compared to 9.5 Nike running shoe. Having said that, after a sunny 9 mile snow hike, I appreciated the extra space and waterproofing. I could do higher tops too if there was more snow, but I’m not into high/mid boots. Basically, these are slightly sturdier, thicker and much more waterproof than running shoes. I wouldn't run in them. Hiking only. Felt weirdly wide (9.5 normal) on cement, but felt good on the trail itself. I’ll keep em. I could use a way to keep the laces tied better.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: These shoes make my heels hurt.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes meet most of my criteria for a good shoe (e.g. waterproof, durable, etc.). However, the very most important thing for me is that my feet need to be comfortable. These shoes absolutely kill my heels (I've never had any problems with heel pain prior to these shoes) to the point where I'm just going to have to throw them away. What a shame! Think twice before buying these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: mark R.

customer_reviews.title: Wide Shoe - Perfect Fit for Every Occasion
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is amazing. I wear a 10.5 Wide and am a fairly active guy. I tested these on 1-2 hour long walks around town, long hikes through woods, fishing, camping, walking around work (carpet and warehouse concrete), and more. Ive had these now for several months and they have been holding up very well with keeping my feet comfortable and the structure of the shoe lasting. I am impressed. I will be ordering another pair and making these my new standard shoe,
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Good wet traction; sturdy shoe; runs a bit small
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes for hiking and didn't have time to adequately break them in. They did run a bit small so the comfort level was not great because of that (if I would have had time to send them back and get slightly larger shoes, I would have!) Given the slightly tight fit on my size 10-1/2 feet, my feet were still not sore after a 6-mile hike up and down hills along some falls in Rickett's Glen State Park in Pennsylvania. The path and stairs/rocks were quite wet from a lot of recent rain, but my feet stayed nice a dry and I did not experience any slipping problems.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: The only brand that I buy
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding shoe that I cannot really wear out and in my size (15). I now own 4 pairs of this shoe in various states of dilapidation and pair #1 purchased in 2011 has finally had the sole separate from the upper. I generally buy new because of paint splatter, grease or some other stupid move on my part. The price(s) that I have paid over the years have generally been within $5 (or Less) of the previous pair, so I know I am not getting gouged. I really don't know how this company stays in business providing a shoe this long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Sam560

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, but a pain to walk in.
customer_reviews.text: The ordering, delivery, and size are all fine. My issue is the right shoe. The left shoe fits fine and after a couple of walks is broken in and fits great. The right shoe has a plastic piece in the heal that is very stiff and catches on my heal, giving me blisters. I figured it would get better after it breaks in. No such luck. I'm trying everything I know to fix the problem but if I can't, it's going to be a $100.00 dog toy.
customer_reviews.author: JohnH

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality shoe in this run- others have been much better.
customer_reviews.text: Not waterproof, also the glue holding the footbed is low quality and needed shoe goo repair almost immediately. Not what they used to be. Vibram also came coated with a very slippery film that took some washing to remove. Extremely slippery on normal wet surfaces- concrete, tile, grass.
customer_reviews.author: P. Middy

customer_reviews.title: Nice comfy walking shoes. No, fantastic walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: They run small. I returned the first pair for the next size up. Fits great. Very comfy. Good looking shoes.Well made. The grey looks great with jeans. So far so good. I really like them. Well, I've worn them enough to edit my review to reflect my satisfaction with these shoes. They give my feet good support and my feet feel great after wearing them all day. The waterproofing does not make my feet sweat. I have balance problems and these shoes help me stay anchored to the walking surface and I am steady more often
customer_reviews.author: KansasScout

customer_reviews.title: Ok shoe but NOT " WATER PROOF"!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok first off I hike all the time so I was looking for a decent hiking shoe that felt good and had good performance . The fit is good and the shoe looks nice . I do however have a issue , these are advertised as "WATER PROOF" THEY ARE NOT!! me and my buddy both bought this same shoe and both of use had wet socks and shoes after stepping in a puddle . So the claim that they are water proof is a lie and needs to be changed . Disappointing. Other then that these are average wearable hiking shoes .
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical about Merrell's "Waterproof" claim. As a test, walked the dog in hilly pasture with wet grass/weeds, 6+ inches tall for 2 hours. After the walk, amazingly, the inside of the shoes, feet, and socks were completely dry! How the mesh material kept all the water out was very impressive. These shoes (from Vietnam) are made of high quality material, comfortable, fit well, easy to tie strong laces, and the soles are rugged/non-slip.
customer_reviews.author: rekees

customer_reviews.title: The  best hikers ever. Comfy, Support, Tough, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Merrell Men's Moab 2 Waterproof Hiking Shoes are the best and only hiker I will purchase. Have the boots and these MOAB 2 and they are supper comfy, good cushion, very sturdy, well made, great support and they look great too! I really like the toe room and the wider fit for thicker sock room. Yes they are waterproof and you should treat them with a spray before trips or ever couple months. Merrell shoes are the best! I love good quality shoes. Buy them!
customer_reviews.author: Steve O

customer_reviews.title: Merrell makes a good shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a lot of Merrell's over the years. And I"m not sure if my foot is getting bigger (like the rest of me!) or these are getting smaller. But this is the first pair I've gotten that I felt were too snug. They might stretch out but so far they're a bit tight. Quality-wise, they're what you expect from Merrell: good quality, well-made, no loose strings, etc. I've bought this exact pair before and was very pleased with the life of them. Used them for everything from everyday use around town to moderate hiking.
customer_reviews.author: MichiganTraveler

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, but waterproof feature reduces breathability
customer_reviews.text: I had the earlier (non-water-proof) version of this shoe for several years, and I liked it so much I decided to get this latest waterproof version. This shoe fits slightly smaller, so I had to go up one-half size. It's a bit stiffer than my first pair, but has good arch support and excellent tread grip, even in wet conditions. My only challenge is with the breathability of the shoe. The waterproof feature clearly reduces the airflow, resulting in sweaty feet even in 60 degree weather, so I suspect hot days this summer will lead to some damp socks from the inside out. I'm doing some notable hiking soon, so eager to give it a go.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Another pair of Merrill’s
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes. I have had several pairs of Merrill’s and they have all been very durable. This and others are very stiff and somewhat hard on the feet. I have replaced the insole with a Dr Scholls gel insole, which I trimmed, and they are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: GBK

customer_reviews.title: Repeat buy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes. I love them. Last pair lasted a good 8 years till the sole started to peel away. Last pair was goretex and this pair is the knock off version. I think this pair seems a little hotter and does not let my feet breathe as well. Have to gotten to find out how well the water proofing does yet.
customer_reviews.author: James Winn

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Might be warm in summer
customer_reviews.text: So far the shoes are as expected. Quality seems good. I had the non water resistant version previously so thought I’d try this style. My old pair is 2 years old and still wearable. I’m interested to see how these perform when weather gets warmer as there isn’t ventilation given these prevent water from coming in. My guess is I’ll wear my old pair in summer. I’ve walked a bit in these and over rocks and they seem good so far. They do keep my feet warm in winter although these aren’t winter shoes per se. Hopefully they hold up as long as the old pair but a couple weeks in the review is positive.
customer_reviews.author: Booklover

customer_reviews.title: READ BELOW
customer_reviews.text: I liked the moab 2 in black that I received 3 days ago I went ahead and ordered it in granite the material on the inside of the black is one piece all black and very comfortable!! the granite one on the inside has 2 pieces?? bottom half is black the top half is gray with a seam in the middle that runs all the way around the inside which i can feel wearing thick athletic socks making it very uncomfortable they should have left the inside all one color either black or gray??????
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and quality
customer_reviews.text: Quality and great fit. Merrell is our new go-to for husband's work shoes. This is his second pair. He is super tough on shoes, works in the gas utility business, and his last pair lasted a year. Considering Adidas and Nike were broken down within 3-6 months, and were difficult to find in 11.5 Wide, we are pleased. These are also water proof and and no more expensive than the other brands. He used RedWing boots for many years, but needs more of an athletic hiking boot for what he does now. These work.
customer_reviews.author: K. Givens

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for the Inca Trail in Peru
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these and was so pleased. Required pretty much no break in. Felt comfortable right away. Hiked these on the Inca Trail in Peru and other mountains/jungle area. Performed flawless. No hot spots, no blisters, fits true to size, very comfortable. Over 40 miles of hiking high altitude in under one week and it passed my test. I'll forever buy these only for hiking needs.
customer_reviews.author: Lor's Auto Parts

customer_reviews.title: "Waterproofness" of these is questionable. Just walked in wet ...
customer_reviews.text: "Waterproofness" of these is questionable. Just walked in wet grass with a few puddles with the dog for 1/2 mile. Bottom of feet wet when got back home. Water not from flowing over top of shoes . Had to come in thru the shoe. I've had these for months with no issue but now they're leaking. These might be ok for wet grass but puddles/standing water seem to present a problem.
customer_reviews.author: willyd

customer_reviews.title: too small AND too large & I have four pairs of Merrels that fit
customer_reviews.text: I have four pairs of Merrel shoes - A hiking boot a pair of leather hiking shoe and 2 pairs of tennis shoes. They all fit my 9 1/2 foot perfectly. I bought this Moab hiking shoe in a 9 1/2 and they were too short in the toe. I exchanged them for a pair of 10's and they were too wide in the body of the shoe and slopped around my ankle even when tightened. Maybe they are switching to Vietnam from China because of the trade debacle. Pity.
customer_reviews.author: Chaos

customer_reviews.title: Great but
customer_reviews.text: I like Merrell Moab 2’s, have 3 pairs. I blundered into buying size 12, rather than my usual 12.5, since Amazon didn’t offer 12.5. Consequently, they hurt my toes on downslopes. Aside from that major drawback, these shoes (and the corresponding boots) deserve the second highest rating for boots and shoes they have on switchbacktravel.com. Very comfortable at the right size. Decent traction.
customer_reviews.author: islander

customer_reviews.title: A serious walking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a serious hiking shoe. The foot bed is firm but comfortable and the heel box seems very supportive for stability. Granted, I just received these and have so far only gone to my mail box which is 1\4 mile down a dirt road but the experience was similar to when I wear work boots and not at all like when I wear tennis type shoes. The packaging did suffer from handing by the shipper. Looked like it dragged behind the truck! The shoes were ok but the package was nearly destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Dean

customer_reviews.title: Second pair
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes. I usually wear out the soles before I run into problems with upper part of the shoe. I love these waterproof shoes. I'm an amateur photographer and usually out early in the morning when there is a lot of dew on the ground. I'm usually putting on 5 to 10 miles a day on these shoes and they last me about a year before the bottoms are wore out. During the winter I wear another Merrell high top boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for rain/snow/ice!
customer_reviews.text: So far these shoes have been great. I have done several hikes in the mountains in deep.. deep snow and these kept my feet incredibly warm even when show did manage to get it (wear your high tops in snow lol) the tread was very good only slipped a little on solid ice but even then more traction then expected. These do get a bit warm so I would opt for a different version for summer hiking but overall I would gladly buy another Marrell product! will update after another couple months of hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: NOT waterproof
customer_reviews.text: While these shoes feel great out of the box, they are not waterproof unfortunately. After two months, the toe box on my left shoe is a like a sieve. My sock is always drenched after walking through damp weeds and grass. Very disappointed because I love everything else about the shoes. But the main reason I bought them was because they claimed to be waterproof. I also noticed that on the tongue of each shoe, the QR code was blacked out with a sharpie (see photo), which makes me think they may not have been new.
customer_reviews.author: CBock

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes. I ordered the same size, model and color as I have been wearing for two years. The shoe that arrived was too small and the wrong color. Could have lived with the color but not with the shoes being too small. So, I sent them back for a refund. How does the same size shoe become two different sizes?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoe in expectation of a trip to Alaska. The trip had to be put off but I kept the shoes. These are excellent. They fit perfectly. They are very comfortable. They are water proof and they look good. I will definitely buy another pair in the future and I would recommend them to anyone. Merrell are quickly becoming my favorite brand of shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were exactly the same as what I had been wearing for several years and needed to be retired. Unfortunately, when I received them I put them in the closet and didn't try them on for several months past the return date. They are not wide, but very narrow and there is hardly enough lace to tie them. I had to take the inserts I put in back out and that gave me a little more room but they are still too uncomfortable and will probably be donated to a shelter. I learned that you need to try shoes on before you buy them.. No more online ordering for me. A big and expensive disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: R.E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: FIT
customer_reviews.text: I gave these shoes a three star rating but honestly I never really gave them a work out as I returned them. I bought these shoes but only tried them for fit while walking around my house. I ultimately chose another pair of Merrell's that I had bought online at the same time and sent these back. The other pair fit more comfortably in hiking socks than these did.
customer_reviews.author: P. Winston

customer_reviews.title: Little traction on wet surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I like the color combo & overall look of the shoe. They did keep my feet dry during rainy weather. However, I had some problems. First, if you want to wear a thicker sock, go up a half size. Second, I was very, very disappointed in the lack of traction on wet floors, streets & sidewalks. Having broken my ankle, I really want to be able to walk without fear of slipping. Huge disappointment in their performance! Last, the insert is not at all comfortable. They were fine after I used OTC orthotics. I have a difficult time finding shoes to fit my problem feet and this was one of the few that came in XW.
customer_reviews.author: The Cleaning Fairy

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for camping and hiking...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes for a Boy Scout camping trip with my son and loved them! I am a big guy and they sustained my weight beautifully. They have good arch support. I used them all week for long walks and hikes and loved them. They are durable, waterproof and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Socarras

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, amazing shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is honestly one of the best shoes I've ever had. I had another pair of Merrells that I bought about 7 years ago which are still holding up. These are a lower cut, so easier to use for day to day. I've been enjoying the water proof and warmth while walking the dog this winter. Great traction on ice and snow, and wet grass hills. Definitely looking forward to using these this summer in the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I just hiked the grand canyon a number of miles of it in snow and slush. These shoes were truly waterproof. wore gaiters and was very pleased with staying very dry. The downside of waterproof Merrell's is that they are hot. I believe that these will be very uncomfortable in warm weather. They do not breathe which is reasonable. So the waterproof property is at a cost. I was pleased with these ... did not have a long break in period and in over 20 miles of hiking did not have a single blister. So I have to give these five stars.
customer_reviews.author: hank

customer_reviews.title: Quality you can count on
customer_reviews.text: Merrill makes an excellent product - these shoes are no exception. Bought for my spouse after I fell in love with a pair I bought for myself. He was skeptical after being disappointed by other brands. No breaking in period required. After wearing these in rain and on slippery trails, he was sold. He can't believe how confident he is of his footing when wearing these. And his feet remain dry. It's a great shoe
customer_reviews.author: Nancy T.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite daily work shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very well made shoe. I burn through shoes every 4 months walking 5 miles a day average. These are very comfortable after about 4 hours of break-in. I will buy another pair for sure. Normally I wear ASICS but they wear out too fast. These have much better rear build/support by my ankle and don't slide around. Amazing grip on wet and oily surfaces too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ayers

customer_reviews.title: I like these
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I've purchased(slightly different colors) The first pair are still functional but I wanted another pair before the rainy season and to have some that don't show so much wear. The only thing that has gone wrong with the first pair is I pulled too hard on the back loop of one and broke it and they aren't as waterproof as they were originally..good shoes
customer_reviews.author: J. K. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and supportive.
customer_reviews.text: Feel and look good. A tiny bit small. I should have gone next size up. Problem is I take 11 in Asics but 10 1/2 in New Balance. So, I went with the 10 1/2. They aren't tight but that may change if I am hiking for hours as feet tend to swell in that situation. Very supportive and the sole lugs give good traction in wet situations. Can't yet comment on quality of water proofing, but these are highly rated so I don't expect a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Versace

customer_reviews.title: Nice, versitile shoe...
customer_reviews.text: These are my go-to shoes for hiking, work, and daytime pub crawls. I have a pair that I use often and have a new pair on hand to rotate in when the others get ratty. I have a wide foot at 10-1/2 which is tough to find. I will buys these as long as they are available. Not good for sporting like football, basketball, or any running as the ankle is high. Best to stick with walking/hiking/yardwork/work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's exactly the same size as my last pair but ...
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly the same size as my last pair but they fit too large. Really can't wear them. Looking into returning them for a smaller pair.
customer_reviews.author: David Phillips

customer_reviews.title: The Merrill MOAB is a great shoe. Well constructed and a jive reinterpretation of ...
customer_reviews.text: The Merrill MOAB is a great shoe. Well constructed and a jive reinterpretation of its predecessor. That being said, it runs smaller than my older Merrells. I have to wear my thinnest pair of socks and the shoe is still almost too small. I won’t return them as a 12.5 would likely be too big, but I will think twice for my next purchase or try them on at a store like REI before committing. They’re a great shoe. Thanks, Merrill.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: What a hiking shoe should be!
customer_reviews.text: The Merrell Men's Moab 2 Waterproof Hiking Shoe is a good looking hiking shoe. I don't limit my use of this shoe to hiking. It is my all around 'go to' shoe each morning. From the first time I put it on, right out of the box, it fit like one of my old hiking shoes, some cost twice what this Merrell cost. I definitely recommend this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Saul Rogovin

customer_reviews.title: Fit right.  Shoelaces improved.  Very thick soles.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit well. They fell very slightly heavier than I remembered/expected. Not problematic. Also, they had soles thick enough that I noticed the difference in terms of my height. Maybe a 1/2 inch lift? Not sure. It's great that Merrell's shoelaces are no longer a menace. Solid arch support. Everything you expect from Merrell.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kehoe

customer_reviews.title: Great fit. Durable for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I had the original Moabs which I loved even though I had to exchange them due to a defect.... these Moab 2s are better. Fit true to size. Enough room in the toes but not sloppy. Lace up fast. A little warm in summer but they have the extra breathable waterproof membrane so that’s to be expected. I’ll buy another pair when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: These are solid shoes with a strong, durable sole that can handle rocks, gravel and rougher terrain, but still light enough to provide walking comfort. Easy to pack as well, they make a versatile travel shoe if you’re looking for something casual-not a shoe that goes with a sport coat per se, but it’s muted enough in color and style to get away with it. They are snug; I’d almost say somewhat small but they really fit exactly right and I’m looking forward to testing them on the trail. I can’t speak for the waterproof promise or their durability over the long term, but I’m looking forward to finding out.
customer_reviews.author: D. de Vries

customer_reviews.title: A solid, water-resistant choice
customer_reviews.text: I like the styling of these shoes -- it is the second pair I've owned. Sporty, but not overly festooned. Comfortable after a few wearings to break them in. They are advertised as waterproof, but I wouldn't test them in extreme rain or somewhat deep snow, but they keep your feet dry enough in moderately inclement conditions. Despite the treads, they can be surprisingly slippery until the soles are roughed up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Merrell becoming inconsistent with their sizes
customer_reviews.text: In general I like these shoes. I've been buying Merrell Moab style shoes for more than ten years. They're usually very comfortable and durable. But I've noticed that the last few pairs have been inconsistent in sizing. The high-top boots I bought last year fit perfect. But this pair is more snug, and they're the same size?
customer_reviews.author: M. Maccollin

customer_reviews.title: Great option for those that hate big hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for a hiking trip in the Grand Tetons. They did not disappoint. Very comfortable, fit as expected. They are pretty heavy, but not so much you notice when they are on your feet. I did not test the water proof claim. These are a good option for those who hate bulky hiking boots. This lower topped, slip on slip off shoe is pretty awesome and can be used all around, even as a daily shoe in a business casual setting. Great job Merrell.
customer_reviews.author: TheStig

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable hiking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Took these hiking shoes on a trip to Asheville. Worked exactly as I needed them to. Very comfortable, weren't too hot for my feet and I actually kept them on AFTER we were finished hiking they were so comfortable! Had no issues with the waterproofing, but they also were not completely submerged. However it did rain quite a bit and I had no problem at all. Highly recommend these hiking shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Prekop

customer_reviews.title: Awesome comfort
customer_reviews.text: Awesome comfortable, waterproof shoes! Great for casual walking around or hiking, or some muddy areas. Fit is supportive, true, and grips well on wrt or slick surfaces Waterproof for rainy days too! Mrs has a pair now too, loves them also. If will be used mostly for hiking, suggest higher ankle-support Merrell’s.
customer_reviews.author: N. Caronna

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: The sole started to come apart after 2 months. I contacted Merrill. They hard me fill out a form and said they would get back to me. It’s been a week with no response from them other than the daily emails to buy more shoes. They have not taken care of me. The shoe fits great and a understand that there could be a random bad pair of shoes. What is garbage is that NO ONE has responded in over a week to a warranty issue. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.author: Workinglots

customer_reviews.title: Great for Seattle weather
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my regular Merrell Moabs would get soaked went it was raining. The waterproofing on these worked great for walking in the rain and they are warmer than the regular Moabs so they were comfortable throughout the Seattle winter. The downside to them is that they aren't so good on warm, sunny days. They get too hot. Use them on the rainy days and you'll be very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: Best low cuts ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 6th pair of MOABs in the last 10 years. Like always, they fit and feel like a glove! I have always worn a US 10.5 D, but this is the first time I may have wanted to go with a wide. I don’t know if they changed the width standards, or if it is the difference between a Moab and a Moab2 waterproof. Regardless, these are my “go to” shoes. Casual hiking, sneakers, just running to the store, these are the most comfortable sneakers/low cut hiking boots I have ever owned, and I will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes, this is my second pair
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I had a pair of these that I bought several years ago and I really liked them. I was afraid that they might be too hot for everyday wear but they were not. Water resistance so my feet stay dry walking through wet grass. They held up really well but I finally wore the soles down pretty far and my toes dug down through the insoles. I would not call that wear excessive, I just wore the heck out of them.
customer_reviews.author: ATCZERO

customer_reviews.title: As Good As Ever
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing a similar pair of Merrells for eleven years for cold weather hiking and camping. They have been so comfortable that I got this pair for everyday wear. So far that is working out perfectly though I probably continue to use the old ones in the woods just to see how far they can go before completely falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable men's hiking shoe out of the box like it that they're waterproof and have a Vibram sole wear them for the summer putting in lawns and doing landscaping and dirt work construction after about four months their garbage for me but comfort and wide width makes up for it used to buy Columbia's could buy two pair for the price of one of these but those are too narrow squeeze my toes
customer_reviews.author: Wetz123

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2nd pair
customer_reviews.text: I had another set of similar boots prior to the getting the Moabs, the others sole came apart after about 4 months, the Merrils lasted about 9 months wearing them for work almost every day. My feet didn't get wet until I stepped on a short nail and punctured the sole. I liked the Merrill Moabs so much I bought another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L Pomeroy

customer_reviews.title: One of my new fave shoes
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought these for my birthday. Initially, I didn't like them because I'm not into the color scheme too much. But, after wearing them a couple of times, I will say these are extremely comfortable and durable! I have problems with one of my feet, and these have a large toebox that allows for orthodics. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

customer_reviews.title: Great all around shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair / I use them for everything - I climb Stone Mountain near me most mornings and then wear to work. Great grip, which is critical to me, plus I have some foot problems and these shoes don’t exacerbate them. Order a size larger than you need (in my experience). / great comfortable, all purpose shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: The shoes run narrow
customer_reviews.text: I have this exact same shoe from 3 years ago and I ordered the same size... the new shoes are really tight and when I held the new ones up to my old ones they look a bit smaller/ more narrow. I don't know why they would be different but they are so now I probably need to return them. It is a great looking shoe and seems to be made really well just order a 1/2 size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Helene Wiese

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky shoes
customer_reviews.text: Everything was OK until about 2 months after I bought them, they started to squeak ,like crazy, when I walked. I tried everything including "baby powder" and nothing worked. I'm sure it's a one-off thing. I've bought Merrell shoes many time with total satisfaction. Very disappointed. Considered returning them but was informed it would have to be in the original box they came in. Like, everyone saves their shoe box just in case!! I am disappointed but would not hesitate to buy Merrell shoes again. NOT ONLINE, THO.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried these through Amazon Wardrobe, and I am very thankful I could return them. I have had several other Merrels for running and have loved them. I wanted to love these for hiking but I just couldn't. They just did not feel like my other Merrels. The toe box and fit were completely different. That being said, they did appear to be of the same quality that I expected them to have. I am sure these are and will be great shoes for other people. Wardrobe was amazingly easy and hassle free.
customer_reviews.author: Smiths

customer_reviews.title: not true to size, poor workmanship
customer_reviews.text: these fit at least 1/2 size smaller than my normal size. Within 2 months of light office and casual wear (no hiking or other off-road use) the uppers separated from the sole on BOTH shoes within a week of each other. I had to use a clamp and shoe goo to repair. I will not purchase Merrill's again.
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: Good fit but 2 heavy 4 me
customer_reviews.text: Still looking for Merrell to replace my All Out Blaze original. Moab2 wide fits well but is just too heavy for me. Had to return. Hope Merrell comes out with another shoe like the original All Out Blaze with wide toe, sewed insole and light weight. All Out Blaze 2 does not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: rodney

customer_reviews.title: No break-in needed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought size 15, very comfortable right out of the box and fit great. If had to find a gripe, it would be that the arch support is a hair too far towards the heel, but isn’t a deal killer. I might add the high boot MOAB 2 to the collection for colder weather. Overall, I’m very pleased with my purchase. Oh, and thanks for having my size in stock!
customer_reviews.author: Eric A.

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes for a trip where I would be walking on rough paving stones and moderate unpaved roads. They have provided the protection I needed, were completely waterproof, and were Comfortable. Being low cut they don’t provide ankle support or protection, and they’re not for serious mountain work, but for moderately rough hiking they’re great.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Have tailors bunnion and bone spurs - great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Years of hard work damage feet. Hard to find shoe that is comfortable. These are great! Use them for everything and frequently for golfing (I walk) I ordered one size bigger in wide width and then put Sole brand insert in them. I have walk 7-10 miles outdoors and no pain. Waterproof so great for golf. Hold up well. Only negative is laces. I double knot them as they are waxed laces and single immediately comes undone. On my second pair, not due to wear, wanted second pair for color.
customer_reviews.author: Matt - Pontoon Boat Owner

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Moab 2 Waterproof Hiking Shoe
product_meta.description: Experience out-of-the-box comfort in waterproof hiking shoes. With durable leathers, a supportive footbed, and Vibram traction, the Moab has been worn on the feet of nearly 20 million people since its inception.
feature_bullets: M Select DRY seals out water and lets moisture escape so you stay dry when you're on the move
Performance suede leather and mesh upper
Bellows, closed-cell foam tongue keeps moisture and debris out
